citation.article-title: Flavobacterium cauense sp. nov., isolated from sediment of a eutrophic lake
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Flavobacterium cauense sp. nov.
Flavobacterium cauense (cau.en′se. N.L. neut. adj. cauense pertaining to CAU, the acronym of the China Agricultural University, where taxonomic studies were performed).
Cells are aerobic, Gram-negative rods about 0.5 μm in diameter and 1.5–3.0 μm in length and motile by gliding.
Colonies grown on R2A agar are circular, yellow and about 1 mm in diameter.
Growth occurs at 20–37 °C (optimum, 28 °C), at pH 5.5–8.0 (optimum, pH 7.5) and with 0–1.0 % NaCl (optimum, 0 %).
Growth occurs on NA and LB agar.
Oxidase- and catalase-positive.
Flexirubin-type pigments are present.
H2S is produced.
Negative for anaerobic denitrification, nitrate reduction and methyl red reaction.
ONPG is not hydrolysed.
Gelatin is liquefied.
Positive for hydrolysis of casein, but negative for hydrolysis of starch, carboxymethyl-cellulose, pectin, Tween 80 and DNA.
Forms precipitate on egg-yolk agar.
Degrades tyrosine but no brown pigment is produced on tyrosine agar.
Glucose is oxidized.

Does not assimilate any of the carbohydrates tested: maltose, sucrose, d-glucose, salicin, lactose, d-fructose, melezitose, d-galactose, raffinose, d-mannose, mannitol, l-rhamnose, trehalose, melibiose, myo-inositol, d-sorbitol, sodium succinate, d-xylose, d-sorbose, d-sodium gluconate, inulin, d-arabinose, l-arabinose, d-ribose, trisodium citrate dehydrate, l-asparagine, n-butanol or glycerol.
Lecithinase activity is present but β-galactosidase, urease, tryptophan deaminase, DNase and lipase activities are absent.
Major cellular fatty acids (>5 %) are 15 : 0 iso, 17 : 1 iso ω9c, 17 : 0 iso 3-OH, 15 : 1 iso G and 15 : 0 iso 3-OH.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 37.7 mol%.
The type strain, R2A-7T (=CGMCC 1.7270T=NBRC 104929T), was isolated from sediment of Taihu Lake in Jiangsu Province, China.
